intro: Bennettiodendron brevipes var. margopatense, commonly known as the Margopatens bennettiodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, with small, simple leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
